intro: Secamone longiflora, commonly known as the long-flowered secamone, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Secamone longiflora is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and shrublands.
